com.nuix.javaenginesimple

Class LicenseFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nuix.javaenginesimple.LicenseFilter

  • public class LicenseFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    Specifies minimum requirements you may have when obtaining a license. Used by EngineWrapper when iterating available licenses to determine which one to pick from those available.
    Author:
    Jason Wells

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LicenseFilter()
      Creates a new instance which by default will accept any license.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void acquireAnyLicense()
      Resets filtering criteria of this instance such that it will accept any license configuration.
      void addRequiredFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
      Adds a specified feature to the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.
      void clearRequiredFeatures()
      Removes all features from the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.
      int getMaxWorkers()
      Gets the maximum number of workers that can be present in a license for this filter to approve it.

      Gets the minimum number of workers that must be present in a license for this filter to approve it.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRequiredFeatures()
      Gets the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.
      java.lang.String getShortName()
      Gets the required short name (such as "enterprise-workstation") that a license must have for this filter to approve it.
      boolean isValid(nuix.engine.AvailableLicence license)
      Checks the configured license requirements of this instance against a given license.

      Sets the maximum number of workers that can be present in a license for this filter to approve it.

      Sets the minimum number of workers that must be present in a license for this filter to approve it.

      Sets the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.

      Sets the required short name (such as "enterprise-workstation") that a license must have for this filter to approve it.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LicenseFilter

        public LicenseFilter()
        Creates a new instance which by default will accept any license.

    • Method Detail

      • acquireAnyLicense

        public void acquireAnyLicense()
        Resets filtering criteria of this instance such that it will accept any license configuration.

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(nuix.engine.AvailableLicence license)
        Checks the configured license requirements of this instance against a given license. If all requirements are found to have been met, returns true. If any requirement is found to have been not met, returns false.
        Parameters:
        license - The license to inspect.
        Returns:
        True if all requirements met, false if any requirement has not been met.

      • getMinWorkers

        public int getMinWorkers()
        Gets the minimum number of workers that must be present in a license for this filter to approve it. Note that when a given license allows you to select the number of workers to acquire from a pool of workers, this value will be the number of workers requested from the pool.
        Returns:
        The minimum number of workers that must be present in a license. A value of 0 means no minimum.

      • setMinWorkers

        public void setMinWorkers(int minWorkers)
        Sets the minimum number of workers that must be present in a license for this filter to approve it. Note that when a given license allows you to select the number of workers to acquire from a pool of workers, this value will be the number of workers requested from the pool.
        Parameters:
        minWorkers - The minimum number of workers that must be present in a license. A value of 0 mean no minimum.

      • getMaxWorkers

        public int getMaxWorkers()
        Gets the maximum number of workers that can be present in a license for this filter to approve it. Note that this filtering criteria is only considered when a given license has a fixed number of workers associated.
        Returns:
        The maximum number of workers that can be present in a license. A value of 0 means no maximum.

      • setMaxWorkers

        public void setMaxWorkers(int maxWorkers)
        Sets the maximum number of workers that can be present in a license for this filter to approve it. Note that this filtering criteria is only considered when a given license has a fixed number of workers associated.
        Parameters:
        maxWorkers - The maximum number of workers that can be present in a license. A value of 0 means no maximum.

      • getShortName

        public java.lang.String getShortName()
        Gets the required short name (such as "enterprise-workstation") that a license must have for this filter to approve it.
        Returns:
        The required short name a license must have to be approved by this filter. A value of null means this requirement is ignored.

      • setShortName

        public void setShortName(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the required short name (such as "enterprise-workstation") that a license must have for this filter to approve it.
        Parameters:
        name - The required short name a license must have to be approved by this filter. A value of null means this requirement is ignored.

      • getRequiredFeatures

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getRequiredFeatures()
        Gets the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.
        Returns:
        List of required features

      • setRequiredFeatures

        public void setRequiredFeatures(java.util.List<java.lang.String> requiredFeatures)
        Sets the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.
        Parameters:
        requiredFeatures - List of required feature names. Providing an empty list or null means this requirement is ignored.

      • addRequiredFeature

        public void addRequiredFeature(java.lang.String featureName)
        Adds a specified feature to the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it.
        Parameters:
        featureName - The name of a required license feature.

      • clearRequiredFeatures

        public void clearRequiredFeatures()
        Removes all features from the list of required features a license must have for this filter to approve it. This effectively is telling this instance not to filter a license based on what features are present.
